channel.title: Roundup on Error States
channel.description: Recent content in Roundup on Error States

item.title: Roundup 009, October-November 2020
item.description: I spent most of November road tripping across the country, so this roundup included both October and November news on healthcare devices, data bias, machine vision, and broken cars. [Continue Reading]

item.title: Roundup 007, August 2020
item.description: Machine learning, machine vision, machine blindness. Plus, cloud infrastructure and VendorOps. [Continue Reading]

item.title: Roundup 006, July 2020
item.description: Deb Chachra: ‘Alone in my apartment, at dusk, I flip a switch to turn on a light. In that instant, not only are my individual senses augmented (now I can see at night), but I become part of a continent-spanning colossus. My reach extends out for thousands of miles, across a national border, encompassing a nuclear power plant, a massive hydroelectric project, scores of substations, thousands of pylons, and an incalculable amount of human expertise, skill, and labour.’ [Continue Reading]

item.title: Roundup 004, May 2020
item.description: Notes on accessibility, UX, linear algebra, and wifi-hogging grills. [Continue Reading]

item.title: Roundup 002, April 2020
item.description: Error States Roundup 3, April 2020: Machine Vision, Infrastructure, and more on Link NYC. [Continue Reading]
